column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Aside from the personal qualities mentioned above , I think my commitment to fiscal and social policies makes my candidacy most attractive .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=Nepean-Carleton is a very family-oriented riding , so the important issues revolve around education , taxes and healthcare .
#Text=On the education front , the Family Coalition Party recognizes the parents as those primarily responsible for the education of their children .
#Text=We therefore propose a voucher system , where parents receive a voucher for each child and use it to fund the school of their choice , whether public or private , religious or not .

#Text=This system would stimulate competition between schools and allow for greater local initiative , as there would be a greater opportunity for private individuals to start schools and fill needs without having to go through the public system .
#Text=With respect to taxes : we propose that the personal and spousal exemption be raised to $ 14 000 a year .
#Text=We also think that there should be tax credits for each child in a family .
#Text=We promote fiscal restraint so that we can keep down the tax burden .
#Text=On Healthcare : We propose a greater involvement of the private sector , while implementing a system of medical savings accounts .
#Text=This system would be paid by the government , but insurance coverage would be provided by a private insurance company .
#Text=The account would consist of CA$ 2000 for each resident , paid by the government .
#Text=Whatever part of this account the individual does not use during the year will be rolled into an RRSP to help fund a retirement pension .
#Text=If treatments cost more than $ 2000 a year for an individual , the insurance company covers those payments .
#Text=The patient would not have to spend any of his own money , but he would have an incentive to not use the system , and the money that is not spent would be invested .
#Text=The insurance company would have an incentive to keep down costs .
#Text=Hospitals would finance themselves through services rendered .
#Text=If the patient chooses , he can purchase his own private insurance .
#Text=I would say that my three top issues are not entirely the same .
#Text=Personally , I believe that the most urgent issue is the absence of legal protection for unborn children , and the fact that our tax dollars go towards paying for abortions .
#Text=Most people favour de-funding abortion , because they recognize that scarce healthcare dollars should go towards treating injury and disease , so I do n’t think this is very controversial .
#Text=This top issue of mine is interrelated with my other two top issues , as well as taxation that I mentioned above .
#Text=They are democratic reform and eliminating excessive bureaucracy .
#Text=Eliminating bureaucracy means less government and fewer taxes .
#Text=That way , families can rely on themselves and not have the government tell them how to spend their money .
#Text=In this way they are somewhat interrelated .
